definition: soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body

sentences.english: My spirit and soul, keep waiting in your heart the door.
sentences.chinese: 我的靈和魂魄，不停守候在妳心門口。

sentences.english: It of the life be all vitalities psyches that the natures living to work properly spirit.
sentences.chinese: 它的命就是所有自然生靈精神的元氣魂魄。

sentences.english: According to legend human bones remove impurities from the iron and steel and bestow the swords with spirit.
sentences.chinese: 根據傳說，人骨使鋼鐵去蕪存菁，並賜予劍魂魄。

sentences.english: Back in the human world, the ghost of Du Liniang visits where Liu Menmei lives.
sentences.chinese: 杜麗娘的魂魄回到人間，找到了柳夢梅寄宿之處。

sentences.english: "Zhang Huan" gets his head knocked by Yong Sheng and Zhang Yang's soul leaves Zhang Huan's body.
sentences.chinese: “張煥”的頭被永盛一敲，張揚的魂魄被彈了出來。

sentences.english: Cliff such as cutting apes were left feeling useless, pedestrian road souls scattered.
sentences.chinese: 峭壁如削猿興嘆，人行棧道魂魄散。

sentences.english: But how does one acquire a new soul?
sentences.chinese: 然而我們是怎麼樣取得一個新的魂魄的？

sentences.english: His heroic swift and fierce dancing, soul sound of fear, with a heavy Yanzhao antiquity .
sentences.chinese: 其舞姿剽悍壯烈，聲懾魂魄，具有濃重的燕趙古風。

sentences.english: In the beginning , Sizhou Drama was called "La Hun Air ", which means the melodiousness of it's singing.
sentences.chinese: 所謂“拉魂腔”指的是唱的動聽，彷彿可以勾人魂魄。

definition: three immortal souls and seven mortal forms in Daoism, contrasting the spiritual and carnal side of man
three immortal souls in Daoism, representing spirit and intellect
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
seven mortal forms in Daoism, representing carnal life and desires/contrasted with 三魂 three immortal souls
soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body
the Yellow Springs/the underworld of Chinese mythology/the equivalent of Hades or Hell
